pr_title: Bugfix for IdentifyContamiant + small improvements to Fingerprinting

timeline.bodyText:
For public API deprecation, adding a javadoc would be nice.
/**
 * Sets the maximal difference in PL scores considered when reading PLs from a VCF.
 *
 * @deprecated since April 2020 Use {@link #setMaximalPLDifference(String)} instead.
 */
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad

timeline.message: - remove max from loglikelihood before converting to probability to protect against an underflow

timeline.author: pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: IMO it would make this clearer to create a local variable for the expression fingerprintEntry.getValue()
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad
pshapiro4broad
pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: This code modifies its argument in place. It looks like it replaces every entry with a new entry. If so, IMO a better model would be to create a new map with the new values and return the new map, instead of overwriting the argument.
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad

replies.author: pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: It looks like this should be fpMap2. If so, it would be nice to have a test that could've found this error.
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: If rg == null then fingerprintIdDetailsMap.containsKey(rg) is always true because the if block above adds null to the map. So it seems like the rg == null test is unnecessary.

replies.bodyText: Is there a reason to use NUM_GENOTYPES here instead of haplotypeProbabilities.getLogLikelihoods().length? Using length would make it clearer what the code is doing; it's copying the entire array.

replies.bodyText: odd case to worry about...but OK.

timeline.bodyText: This operation is also done in CappedHaplotypeProbabilities, would it make sense to make a method for it in MathUtil?
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: This looks like a different operation than MathUtil.max(double[]). The usual rule for overloaded methods is that the overloaded method should perform the same operation as the original. The main use of overloads is so you can provide default argument values. Maybe 'maxCap() and 'minCap()?
timeline.author: pshapiro4broad
pshapiro4broad

timeline.bodyText: Would it be odd for Fingerprint.merge() to return itself? that would make streaming ops like this a bit cleaner to write.

timeline.bodyText: Would this be better as a try-with-resources block?
timeline.author: fleharty

replies.bodyText: what needs to be closed here?
replies.author: yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText:
Why do you have snp.getAllele2() != refAllele?
Isn't allele1 always the reference allele?
timeline.author: fleharty

replies.bodyText: not in the haplotype DB file. in order to deal with snps that are phased in trans. Technically, the columns are MAJOR_ALLELE and MINOR_ALLELE, so you see, the reference could be the minor allele....
replies.author: yfarjoun

timeline.message: - A few modifications to programs involved in fingerprinting so that we would be able to process files with reads that lack a rg tag. should not affect results from valid files.

- fix GIANT bug in IdentifyContaminant (haplotypesBlocks that had the reference base as the "minor" allele were not converted correctly to VCF)
- remove cap on PL when dealing with VCF (not sure why it was there in the first place)
- general cleanups.
- remove max from loglikelihood before converting to probability to protect against an underflow
- bringing back the cap on fingerprints...in a more holistic way.
- first round of responding to review.

- responding to review
- found another bug...this time in the implementation of the tumor-aware LOD....
- this PR includes tests that fail and commented code that will fix them in a subsequent commit
- this is the bugfix for the tumor normal bug
